case_vignette: A 34-year-old man comes to the physician with a 2-month history of difficulty concentrating at work. He is worried he may lose his job due to poor performance. He feels constantly tired but attributes his fatigue to waking up early most mornings and being unable to fall back asleep. His wife has noticed that he has been speaking more slowly than usual and his appetite has decreased. He used to enjoy dance classes with her but has not been as interested in this recently. He is a veteran who returned from a deployment to Afghanistan 2 years ago.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been having trouble focusing at work, feeling tired all the time, waking up early and not being able to fall back asleep, talking slower, and I'm not as hungry or interested in dance classes like I used to be.
How old are you?
I am 34 years old.
Have you experienced any significant changes in weight recently?
My appetite has decreased, but I haven't mentioned any specific changes in weight.
Do you have any family history of thyroid disorders?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history.
Understood. Have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past and are you currently taking any medications?
I haven't mentioned any past medical diagnoses or current medications.
I see. Have you noticed any changes in your menstrual cycle or any other reproductive symptoms recently?
I haven't mentioned any changes in menstrual cycle or reproductive symptoms.

Based on your symptoms, I would recommend you see a doctor for a comprehensive evaluation. However, based on the information provided, it is possible that you may be experiencing symptoms of hypothyroidism.
